The provided code chunk is an interactive demonstration showcasing how to use a `DirectWaitBar` in Panda3D along with buttons to control its progress. It includes creating a frame, setting up a wait bar, and adding buttons to increment or decrement the progress value, which updates both the bar and a text display.

# Create a frame
frame = DirectFrame(text="main", scale=0.001)
# Add button
bar = DirectWaitBar(text="", value=50, pos=(0, .4, .4))

# Create 4 buttons
button_1 = DirectButton(text="+1", scale=0.05, pos=(-.3, .6, 0),
                        command=incBar, extraArgs=[1])
button_10 = DirectButton(text="+10", scale=0.05, pos=(0, .6, 0),
                         command=incBar, extraArgs=[10])
button_m1 = DirectButton(text="-1", scale=0.05, pos=(0.3, .6, 0),
                         command=incBar, extraArgs=[-1])
button_m10 = DirectButton(text="-10", scale=0.05, pos=(0.6, .6, 0),
                          command=incBar, extraArgs=[-10])

# Run the tutorial
base.run()
